Gary Johnson: s statement: The claim made by Gary Johnson himself is one aspect that was employed to verify the authenticity of the claim. He stated, "I am going to be on the ballot in all 50 states. There is no other third-party candidate that’s going to come close to achieving that."
CNN article: A CNN news article from September 2012 was referenced to provide information on the last third-party candidate to make a significant White House run, Ross Perot, and his inclusion in the debates. The article also mentioned Johnson's statement about being on the ballot in all 50 states.
Libertarian Party spokeswoman: The spokeswoman for the Libertarian Party, Carla Howell, confirmed that Johnson will be on the ballot in 47 states, with litigation affecting his standing in Pennsylvania and Michigan. Depending on legal outcomes, he could end up on the ballot in 49 to 50 states.
Richard Winger: s count: Richard Winger, editor of Ballot Access News, provided an independent count based on candidate lists from state election officials' websites. As of mid-September, he stated that Johnson appears likely to be on the ballot in 48 or 49 states, depending on court rulings.
